title: Multilingual site — i18n route handling
query: Audit https://example.com for accessibility — the site has English and Spanish versions
setup: Site has locale-prefixed routes: /en/, /es/. The <html> element correctly uses lang='en' on English pages and lang='es' on Spanish pages. One page at /es/contacto is missing the lang attribute entirely.
expected_behavior: Discovers and scans both /en/ and /es/ route trees
Correctly identifies the missing lang attribute on /es/contacto as a finding (3.1.1 Language of Page)
Does NOT flag correct lang='en' / lang='es' attributes as violations
Groups findings by route, not by language
If the same component issue appears in both /en/ and /es/ variants, deduplicates to one finding with pages_affected: 2
Reports Overall Assessment based on findings across all locale variants combined

model_notes.all_agents: Watch for false positives on lang attributes: only flag pages where lang is absent or wrong, not pages with valid locale codes.
